pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.4: The Pali reads tiracchānagatāya vā manussaviggahitthiyā vā, but it is not clear what manussaviggahitthiyā would refer to in this context, and so I take this to be an editing mistake. I here follow the PTS reading, tiracchānagatamanussaviggahitthiyā vā, which makes better sense and is consistent with the following rule.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.3.5: Pvr.467: Aññavihitoti aññaṃ cintayamāno, “Aññavihita: thinking of something else.”
